answers.answer: My symptoms started around 21 im now 47. i ended up with Myexadema a goiter, nodual and Hashi..then it was oh dam we left you too long!

Sorry to hear the levo is not to good for you, i have done well on 100mcg of thyroxine so far, the doc was amazed at how quickly it worked for me..My only main symptom now is the tiredness and still a bit of brain fog, i do still get a bit of the throat tightness with the goiter and hashi, but i have been lucky by what i see, hope things improve for you..Dawn

I was at first diagnosed with depression and put on prosac(sp) and gained alot of weight, I was 135 then and am now 206 . I got up to 235 at one point, then a counselor figured out I had a thyroid problem and had me tested. I felt horrible and had never been big and hated it and my docs at the time just kept saying it was depression.

This all started either before, during or after pregnancy. I birthed a preemie six years ago, and my health went down from there. Doctors blamed my depression on my weight gain. My weight gain on my napping. My constipation on my anxiety, etc...I was seeing Gastros for three years for IBS, etc. After being misdiagnosed with shingles (Hashi rashes) then parathyroid disease (Hashi caused the low D which caused the PTH to elevate), which finally led me to an endo. He said there was nothing wrong with me, so I went to a new endo. She found a multi-nodular goiter, but continued to test my parathyroid levels for four months, ignoring my high end TSH done by the other endo. SHE DID NOT RUN ANY THYROID TESTS!!!I found this wonderful forum last summer and was told which tests to ask for. Elevated TPOab and frees below range confirmed Hashi. It has been quite a ride!:) Tamra

After going up and down in weight like a yo-yo, mood changes, depression, family history,  'you're normal', 'you're stressed', 'you're a woman',.......rah rah rah rah rah....FINALLY I got the "Oh dear, looks like you have a severe case of Hashimoto's...well, we left it so long you now have Hurthle cells too. Guess we should whip that little bugger out!""REALLY? Says me? I am soooooo grateful to you for wasting freaking 15 years of my life, having my 16 year old son say the other day he has never seen me go to work, be 100% active, be social."Oh do I sound bitter? You bet! STILL going through the garbage of getting my meds right and I keep getting told........wait for it............."It's ANXIETY!"   AAaaaaaaaaargh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
by the way ... it supposed to be at most and not at least !!
Within a month .. routine physical found 2 nodules .. biopsy 2 weeks later .. surgery within 3 mos .. and today it's almost 3yrs and doing well.

About three years ago, I went into the doc because I couldn't lose my weight despite diet changes and regular exercise.  There is a history of diabetes and obesity on my mother's side of the family, so I was really worried about my weight and later developing diabetes.  After much conviencing, finally the doc checked my thyroid which showed normal ranges (though not normal now), but with antibodies present.  Was put on Cytomel, but was never adjusted, and was referred to an endo who took me off of the meds to run another blood test.  Never heard back from him.  So left it alone thinking if the endo didn't think it was a big deal to even call me or see me again, it is a big concern.  Now, new state, new doc who ran a thorough first patient appointment, asked about thyroid.  Told her my story, retested, now on lev.  Still, no one has "formally" said I have a hypothyroid or Hashimoto's.  So, three years and going and still not diagnosised.

Six months to figure out I had hyper/graves, it was not until my goiter had grown and made my neck look like I had the neck of a football lineman. I was 5'2 88lbs, so it was very noticeable.I was treated for depression for six months (I was a new mommy at the time-post partum depressin), until one day saw a different doctor for my swelled neck that he made me stick my hands out, they were shaking uncontrollabley. All history from there. I did hit two thyroid storms due to not being treated properly. But I will let by gones be by gones..

question: how much time it took for you to be diagnosed ?you can comment and add how were you diagnosed briefly !
title: how much time it took for you to be diagnosed ?
